answerText: structural isomers [or isomerism] [10] Benzene has multiple structural isomers, including one shaped like a triangular box and another with two cyclobutene rings joined together. Name either.
heading: NASAT  |2014 | 11 | 14 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question: This phenomenon exists between the compounds n-pentane, isopentane, and neopentane, but not also with cyclopentane. For 10 points each: [10] Identify this phenomenon where compounds share the same molecular formula, but have different Lewis structures.
